you need the savage drivers which should be installed by default in the latest Ubuntu version
what driver does your /etc/X11/xorg.conf file say you are using?
you can find out fast by typing this at the command line:
more /etc/X11/xorg.conf | grep -A 2 'Section "Device"'
cool, that means the savage drivers are installed and you should have 3d working because of it. so you plug in an s-video cable and nothing comes out to the TV?
